item.title: Miriam add a quote by Madeleine L’Engle
item.description: "The artist, if he is not to forget how to listen, must retain the vision which includes angels and dragons and unicorns, and all the lovely creatures which our world would put in a box marked 'Children Only!" -- Madeleine L’Engle

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Dying man couldn't make up his mind which place to go to -- both have their advantages, "heaven for climate, hell for company!" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Miriam add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "You believe in a book that has talking animals, wizards, witches, demons, sticks turning into snakes, burning bushes, food falling from the sky, people walking on water, and all sorts of magical, absurd and primitive stories, and you say that we are the ones that need help?" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "Some things have to be believed to be seen." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "If you are going through hell, keep going." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "Tact is the ability to tell someone to go to hell in such a way that they look forward to the trip." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Between two evils, I always pick the one I never tried before." -- Mae West

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I wrote the story myself. It's about a girl who lost her reputation and never missed it." -- Mae West

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "When I'm good, I'm very good, but when I'm bad, I'm better. " -- Mae West

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Life is a disease: sexually transmitted, and invariably fatal." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Miriam add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Oh, what strange wonderful clocks women are. They nest in Time. They make the flesh that holds fast and binds eternity. They live inside the gift, know power, accept, and need not mention it. Why speak of time when you are Time, and shape the universal moments, as they pass, into warmth and action?" -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Miriam add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "I believe in everything until it's disproved. So I believe in fairies, the myths, dragons. It all exists, even if it's in your mind. Who's to say that dreams and nightmares aren't as real as the here and now?" -- John Lennon
